subject: Re: [junit] Strange decorator in Eclipse
msgSnippet: I believe that Eclipse creates the blue-arrow decorator when the test starts running, and removes it when the test is done, in order to indicate the
messageBody:
I believe that Eclipse creates the blue-arrow decorator when the test
starts running, and removes it when the test is done, in order to
indicate the currently-running test. This behavior would seem to
indicate a test that somehow starts but never finishes.

Is it possible there's an infinite loop? Are you using the Assume class?

David Saff

On Sat, Apr 18, 2009 at 7:43 PM, mikejonathan77 <mdean77@...> wrote:
> Running some tests and a clump of them have a blue arrow decorator rather than the usual green checkbox (Eclipse).  Have attached figure as JunitFigure.jpg.  If I run this class by itself as a JUnit test, it runs fine.  But notice that there is a different decorator and there are no execution times, so I believe these tests simply did not run.
>
